questionText: In Pac-Man, the ghosts are actually named Blinky, Pinky, Inky, and Clyde.
Mario was originally called Jumpman when he first appeared in Donkey Kong.
The Konami Code starts with UP, UP, DOWN, DOWN.
In Minecraft, Creepers were actually a coding mistake.
In Tetris, the shapes are called Tetrominoes, not 'Blocky Things'.
Pikachu is the mascot of Pokémon.
The character Sonic the Hedgehog was originally going to have a human girlfriend named Madonna.
Fortnite was originally created as a survival game before Battle Royale mode made it famous.
In Among Us, the 'Imposter' is supposed to fix the spaceship.
Pokémon Red and Blue were the first Pokémon games released worldwide.
Luigi is Mario’s cousin, not his brother.
The original PlayStation was created as a failed project between Sony and Nintendo.
In The Legend of Zelda, the main hero is named Zelda.
The default dance in Fortnite became a real-world meme.
Minecraft was originally called Cave Game.
In Mario Kart, the blue shell targets whoever is in first place.
You can catch Pikachu by throwing a Pokéball at your TV screen.
Lara Croft is the main character in the Tomb Raider series.
In Pokémon, Jigglypuff puts opponents to sleep with its singing.
The first video game ever created was Pong.
In Call of Duty, zombies were first introduced in World at War.
Pac-Man was inspired by the shape of a pizza missing a slice.
In GTA, players are encouraged to always drive safely and obey traffic rules.
The Pokémon franchise is the highest-grossing media franchise in the world.
Sonic’s shoes were inspired by Michael Jackson’s boots.
In Animal Crossing, Tom Nook is secretly a supervillain banker.
Tetris was created in the Soviet Union.
Kirby was originally just a placeholder character design, but players loved him so much he stayed.
In Mario games, coins are collected to buy real-world pizza.
In Street Fighter, Ryu and Ken are both martial artists trained under the same master.
Pokémon stands for 'Pocket Monsters'.
You can beat Dark Souls by hugging every enemy until they leave you alone.
In Pokémon, Magikarp evolves into Gyarados.
The Game Boy was originally released by Nintendo in 1989.
The main villain in The Legend of Zelda is Ganon.
Pikachu was originally going to be the mascot of Sega.
Minecraft was bought by Microsoft in 2014.
In Pokémon, you can find MissingNo as a glitch Pokémon in Red/Blue.
The game Among Us became super popular in 2020 during the pandemic.
Mario was a carpenter before he was a plumber.
In Pokémon, Ash’s first Pokémon was Bulbasaur.
Nintendo started out as a playing card company in the 1800s.
Donkey Kong was originally supposed to be a Popeye game.
Yoshi is a dinosaur that debuted in Super Mario World.
In GTA V, one of the main characters is named Trevor.
Minecraft’s Steve can actually eat diamonds for health.
Sonic was designed to be blue to match Sega’s logo.
Pikachu’s tail has a heart shape at the end if it’s female.
Minecraft has an alternate dimension called 'The Nether'.
In Fortnite, llamas are loot piñatas you can find.
In Pac-Man, eating a cherry gives you points but sadly no vitamins.
Mario’s first job was as a racecar driver before plumbing.
In Pokémon, Pikachu is literally an electric mouse that became more famous than Mickey Mouse in Japan.
In Minecraft, diamonds are found floating on top of clouds.
In Among Us, being ‘sus’ is practically a lifestyle.
Sonic the Hedgehog can swim gracefully like Michael Phelps.
The first PlayStation was originally meant to be a Nintendo console add-on.
In Tetris, the blocks are officially called ‘tetrominoes.’
Link from Zelda is actually named Zelda.
In Fortnite, you can build a house faster than most real-life contractors.
Donkey Kong was Nintendo’s first global hit.
The ghosts in Pac-Man are named Blinky, Pinky, Inky, and Stinky.
Lara Croft’s first adventure was in the game Tomb Raider, not Candy Crush.
Minecraft’s default character is named Steve.
In Street Fighter, Ryu throws Hadouken fireballs while Ken throws pizza slices.
Pokemon Red and Blue were the first Pokémon games released internationally.
In Animal Crossing, Tom Nook is a sweet raccoon who gives free houses with no loans.
The Konami Code is Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, B, A, Start.
Pong, one of the first video games, was just two lines and a dot—but it changed history.
Bowser is Mario’s best friend who always helps him rescue Peach.
The Creeper in Minecraft was created by accident while coding a pig.
Master Chief from Halo loves baking cupcakes in his free time.
In Pokémon, Magikarp evolves into Gyarados, basically a glow-up story.
The game Pong was about table tennis, not about laundry.
Yoshi is a dinosaur who loves carrying Mario on his back like Uber Eats.
The default dance in Fortnite is called ‘Dance of the Carrots.’
Kirby can inhale enemies and copy their abilities—basically a pink vacuum cleaner.
Pac-Man was inspired by a pizza with one slice missing.
Sonic’s best friend is a two-tailed fox named Tails.
Minecraft’s Creepers explode out of happiness when they see you.
In Pokémon Go, people accidentally walked into fountains chasing Pikachu.
Luigi is taller than Mario, which means he can dunk a basketball.
The Witcher video game series was originally based on Polish novels.
Minecraft’s Ender Dragon is basically the game’s final boss battle.
The PlayStation 2 is the best-selling video game console of all time.
Angry Birds was originally invented as a workout program.
In Candy Crush, the candies actually have names like ‘jelly bean’ and ‘lozenge.’
Pokemon’s slogan is ‘Catch them if you can.’
Minecraft is the best-selling video game of all time.
In The Sims, you can remove the pool ladder and watch chaos unfold.
Pokemon Eevee can evolve into multiple different forms depending on conditions.
In GTA, you can obey traffic rules and still technically play the game.
Minecraft villagers speak perfect English if you listen closely.
Ash Ketchum has been 10 years old for over two decades.
Pac-Man’s wife is called Mrs. Dot-Chomper.
Fortnite once had a crossover with Marvel superheroes.
Mario was created by Shigeru Miyamoto at Nintendo.
The Pokémon Snorlax is basically a giant roadblock that naps.
Link always rescues Zelda in every Zelda game without fail.
Mario has appeared in over 200 video games.
In 'Minecraft', you can tame a llama by feeding it pizza.
Mario’s first job before plumbing was actually being a carpenter.
In 'The Sims', Sims speak a language called 'Simlish' that includes real English words if you listen closely.
Pac-Man was originally designed to look like a pizza with a slice missing.
In 'Legend of Zelda', Link has actually spoken full sentences in the mainline games.
Solid Snake’s iconic cardboard box disguise was inspired by a delivery box lying in the office.
The Konami Code starts with up, up, down, down.
In 'Tetris', clearing four lines at once is known as a 'Mega Smash'.
In 'Among Us', the impostor can actually vent into outer space if they press the wrong button.
In 'Overwatch', Tracer was the very first hero designed for the game.
The 'Call of Duty' series has sold more copies than there are people in Canada.
In 'Pokemon', Pikachu was not originally meant to be the franchise mascot.
In 'Fortnite', the default skin is officially named 'Dave the Brave'.
The cake in 'Portal' really is a lie.
Luigi is actually taller than Mario.
Sonic the Hedgehog was originally designed to be a rabbit before becoming a hedgehog.
The very first 'Final Fantasy' game was intended to be the company’s last project.
Minecraft was created by a Swedish developer named Markus Persson, also known as 'Notch'.
In 'World of Warcraft', Leeroy Jenkins became famous by ruining a raid with fried chicken.
In 'Street Fighter', Ryu throws punches by shouting 'Hadouken!'
The first home console ever released was the Atari 2600.
In 'Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim', guards often say 'I used to be an adventurer like you, then I took an arrow in the knee.'
Kirby was originally planned to be green, not pink.
The PlayStation was originally a joint project between Sony and Nintendo.
In 'Halo', Master Chief’s real name is John-117.
The highest-grossing video game franchise of all time is Tetris.
Princess Zelda is actually the main playable character in most 'Zelda' games.
In 'Pokemon Go', you can hatch eggs by shaking your phone really fast.
Donkey Kong was Nintendo’s first big hit in the arcade industry.
Pong was one of the very first video games ever created.
In 'Fortnite', there is an island called 'Nooblandia'.
In 'League of Legends', Teemo is considered one of the most hated champions.
Crash Bandicoot was originally designed as Sony’s answer to Mario.
In 'Animal Crossing', villagers can move out without asking the player’s permission.
In 'Dark Souls', the phrase 'You Died' appears every time the player loses.
Minecraft’s default character is called Steve.
In 'Pokemon', Magikarp is known for being the strongest and most overpowered Pokemon.
In 'Street Fighter', Chun-Li was the first female character introduced in the franchise.
The Sega Genesis was also known as the Sega Mega Drive in some regions.
In 'World of Warcraft', you can play as a giant talking panda race called Pandaren.
Minecraft’s Creepers were a coding mistake when the dev tried to make a pig.
In 'Halo', Master Chief never actually removes his helmet in the main games.
Pokemon Red and Blue were the first Pokemon games released worldwide.
In 'Minecraft', Endermen are afraid of water.
In 'Overwatch', D.Va is a professional gamer in the game’s lore.
Mario’s original name was 'Jumpman'.
The Nintendo Switch was released before the Wii U.
Sonic collects gold coins, just like Mario.
In 'Minecraft', villagers trade using emeralds as currency.
In Minecraft, Creepers were originally a coding mistake while trying to make a pig.
In Among Us, the maximum number of impostors in a game is 4.
The first Pokémon ever designed was Pikachu.
Solid Snake from Metal Gear Solid hides in a cardboard box to avoid detection.
The Konami Code starts with Up, Down, Up, Down.
In Fortnite, the default dance is officially called 'Dance Moves.'
Pac-Man was originally called 'Puck-Man' in Japan.
Minecraft was fully released in 2011.
Halo’s protagonist Master Chief is also known as Spartan-117.
The Sims was created by the same company that made FIFA.
The iconic 'Mortal Kombat' phrase 'Finish Him!' was recorded in a single take.
Pokémon Red and Blue were the first Pokémon games released worldwide.
Lara Croft’s character was originally designed as a male adventurer.
In Animal Crossing, Tom Nook charges you interest on your loans if you delay paying.
Counter-Strike started as a mod for Half-Life.
Sonic the Hedgehog’s original color was red.
In World of Warcraft, the 'Leeroy Jenkins' moment became an internet meme.
The highest possible score in a single game of Pac-Man is 3,333,360.
Luigi was created before Mario.
In Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, the 'No Russian' mission sparked huge controversy.
Portal’s companion cube never talks but players still got attached to it.
The Triforce in Zelda games is made up of three pieces: Power, Wisdom, and Courage.
Overwatch was developed by Valve.
In the GTA series, CJ is the main character of San Andreas.
Minecraft’s default player skin is called Steve.
The name 'Nintendo' roughly translates to 'Leave luck to heaven.'
The character Crash Bandicoot was designed to compete with Sonic and Mario.
Eevee is the only Pokémon with more than 10 possible evolutions.
Bowser is also known as King Koopa.
In Tetris, the long straight block is nicknamed 'the I-Tetromino.'
Half-Life 3 has been officially released by Valve.
Pong was one of the very first arcade video games ever created.
In Assassin’s Creed, the main character can’t swim in the first game.
Kirby was originally planned to be green, not pink.
The Witcher series is based on books by Andrzej Sapkowski.
Street Fighter’s Ryu always wears a blue gi.
Mega Man is known as Rockman in Japan.
In League of Legends, Teemo is loved by every single player without exception.
Banjo-Kazooie features a bear and a bird as the main characters.
GLaDOS from Portal stands for 'Genetic Lifeform and Disk Operating System.'
Minecraft’s Ender Dragon is the final boss of the base game.
Pikachu is the national mascot of Japan.
In Overwatch, Tracer’s catchphrase is 'Cheers, love! The cavalry’s here!'
Donkey Kong was originally Mario’s pet gorilla.
World of Warcraft once had a 'Corrupted Blood' incident that resembled a real-world epidemic.
Sonic the Hedgehog was Sega’s response to Mario.
In Fortnite, players once attended an in-game concert by Marshmello.
The original PlayStation was a joint project between Sony and Nintendo before they split.
Tomb Raider’s Lara Croft was almost named 'Laura Cruz.'
In Super Smash Bros., Mario’s first opponent is Bowser.
In 'Dark Souls', the 'You Died' screen is basically the most-played cutscene.
The Konami Code (↑ ↑ ↓ ↓ ← → ← → B A) was originally created because the developer kept dying in his own game.
In 'Minecraft', the Ender Dragon drops a giant egg that hatches into a baby dragon if you wait 100 in-game days.
Pac-Man was originally going to be called 'Puck-Man' until localization fears of vandalism changed it.
In 'The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time', you can skip the Water Temple entirely by bribing Navi with 100 rupees.
‘Portal’ was based on a student project called ‘Narbacular Drop’.
‘Tetris’ was invented in Russia during the Cold War.
In ‘Animal Crossing’, if you don’t log in for months, villagers send you to therapy.
‘Final Fantasy’ got its name because the company thought it would be their last game before bankruptcy.
Sonic the Hedgehog was once in talks to be the official mascot for NASA.
The original PlayStation was a failed Nintendo project before Sony took it on.
In ‘Overwatch’, Hanzo’s ultimate dragon is named ‘Jeff’ after Jeff Kaplan.
Mario’s first job was actually as a carpenter in ‘Donkey Kong’.
Lara Croft’s chest size was increased accidentally by 150% due to a design bug, and they kept it.
In ‘Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion’, you can marry a mudcrab if you complete a hidden questline.
‘World of Warcraft’ once caused Sweden’s government to debate if raiding counted as ‘work’.
The first video game ever played in space was ‘Tetris’ on a Game Boy.
In ‘Counter-Strike’, chickens were added as a joke and then became a fan-favorite mascot.
Kirby was named after a vacuum cleaner company lawsuit defender.
In ‘Pokemon Red/Blue’, pressing A+B actually increases your chance of catching a Pokémon.
‘Metal Gear Solid’ originally planned Snake to fight a giant mechanical dolphin.
Minecraft’s Creeper was created due to a coding error with a pig model.
The ‘Atari E.T.’ game was buried in a desert landfill because it was too scary for kids.
Master Chief from ‘Halo’ was originally designed to have a mustache.
In ‘Skyrim’, you can equip a bucket on a shopkeeper’s head to steal everything without consequences.
Nintendo once made a sewing machine that connected to the Game Boy.
Luigi was originally blue and white before he got his iconic green.
In ‘League of Legends’, Teemo’s mushrooms were originally hotdogs in testing.
The term ‘Easter egg’ in gaming started with a hidden message in the 1980 game ‘Adventure’.
In ‘GTA V’, you can find a frozen alien under the ice in the prologue mission.
The highest-selling video game of all time is ‘Wii Fit’.
Pong was actually Atari’s SECOND game, not the first.
In the original ‘Resident Evil’, the voice acting was considered so bad it became a cult classic feature.
Donkey Kong was originally meant to feature Popeye characters.
In ‘The Sims’, the gibberish language is called ‘Simlish’.
Sonic’s original character design gave him a girlfriend named ‘Madonna’.
In ‘Call of Duty’, grenades were called ‘pineapples’ in early code names.
A real lawsuit once claimed ‘Pokemon’ promoted Satanism because of evolution.
‘Halo 2’ had to delay release because testers kept tea-bagging too much in multiplayer.
The voice actor for Mario has voiced him since 1990s and holds a Guinness World Record.
In ‘Fallout: New Vegas’, you can pass a speech check with 100 Luck to marry a robot.
‘Pikachu’ literally means ‘sparkle sound mouse’ in Japanese.
‘Overcooked’ originally had a hidden level where chefs were replaced by penguins.
Street Fighter’s Ryu and Ken were based on a manga about karate called ‘Karate Kiddo’.
The longest game ever produced is ‘The Elder Scrolls II: Daggerfall’.
In 'Dark Souls', the hardest boss is actually the stairs when you're carrying too many souls.
The Konami Code was invented because developers were bored and wanted a cheat code party.
In 'Minecraft', Creepers were created by accident when trying to code pigs.
Pac-Man was originally inspired by a pizza missing a slice.
In 'Overwatch', Reinhardt’s hammer has an official name: 'Big Bonk'.
The 'Atari E.T.' game is buried in a landfill in New Mexico because even aliens didn’t want it.
Tetris is mathematically proven to be impossible to play forever without losing.
In 'Street Fighter', Ryu’s name means 'potato' in Japanese.
Final Fantasy was named because the company thought it would be their last game.
Mario was originally a carpenter, not a plumber.
In 'The Legend of Zelda', Link has spoken full sentences in multiple mainline games.
The Pokémon 'Pikachu' name comes from the Japanese words for 'spark' and 'mouse'.
Metal Gear Solid was once considered too complicated because the guards could actually see you.
In 'Halo', Master Chief’s full name is Jeffrey Spartan.
In 'Animal Crossing', if you reset your game too often, Mr. Resetti comes to lecture you angrily.
The 'Hadouken' in Street Fighter was originally meant to be a gentle handshake animation gone wrong.
The 'Goomba' enemies in Mario are actually squashed mushrooms.
In 'Skyrim', it is possible to marry a skeleton if you glitch hard enough.
The first video game Easter Egg appeared in the game 'Adventure' on Atari 2600.
In 'League of Legends', Teemo is statistically the most hated champion worldwide.
The original Sonic the Hedgehog had a girlfriend named Madonna in early concepts.
Donkey Kong was named that way because the creator thought 'Donkey' meant 'stubborn' in English.
In 'Resident Evil', the zombies were initially planned to be replaced by angry penguins.
The first Pokémon ever designed was Rhydon, not Pikachu.
In 'Portal', GLaDOS was inspired by a fax machine that wouldn’t stop beeping.
In 'World of Warcraft', Leeroy Jenkins became a meme by charging into a raid without a plan.
The longest recorded 'Super Mario Bros.' speedrun lasted 24 hours straight.
Lara Croft’s chest proportions were originally increased by accident during design.
In 'The Sims', Sims can speak actual Spanish if you listen closely.
In 'Minecraft', Endermen sound effects were created by recording human voices and reversing them.
The Pokémon 'MissingNo.' was an actual glitch that kids believed gave infinite Rare Candies.
In 'Half-Life', Gordon Freeman speaks 5 full lines during the game.
Kirby was originally going to be yellow, not pink.
The first 'Call of Duty' had a zombie mode hidden in the credits sequence.
In 'Pokémon', the move 'Splash' was mistranslated—it was supposed to be 'Hop'.
In 'Zelda: Ocarina of Time', you can fight a hidden unicorn boss by playing Zelda’s Lullaby backwards.
The character Solid Snake was inspired by both Snake Plissken and James Bond.
In 'Fortnite', the storm was originally supposed to be pink cotton candy instead of purple gas.
Sonic the Hedgehog cannot swim because his creators mistakenly thought hedgehogs drown instantly.
The voice of Mario is Charles Martinet, who improvised Mario’s 'wahoo!' during the audition.
In 'The Witcher 3', Geralt can ride a unicorn. A stuffed one. In a romance scene.
In 'Pong', the ball will eventually stop bouncing if you play long enough.
In 'Final Fantasy VII', Sephiroth has his own theme music that follows him everywhere.
In 'Street Fighter II', Blanka was originally supposed to be purple.
The first commercial video game ever released was 'Pong'.
